title: Grow Your Seed Vocabulary: Key Terms Every Gardener Should Know

tasks.task: Interpret seed catalog descriptions and terms.
subtasks: Understand the meaning behind technical terms in seed catalog descriptions.
Recognize and differentiate between organic and non-GMO seeds.
Identify heirloom seeds and their significance.
Explain the concept of treated seeds and their purpose.
Understand the distinction between open-pollinated and hybrid seeds.
Note the importance of seed count and packaging.
Identify parthenocarpic plants and their benefits for greenhouse cultivation.
Interpret days to maturity (DTM) information for crop planning.
Consider USDA hardiness zone requirements for perennial plants.
Recognize and match growth habits of plants to garden conditions.
Understand determinant and indeterminate plant growth types.
Identify disease resistance in seeds and plants.
Recognize bolt resistance and its importance in certain crops.
Understand crack resistance in tomatoes and its significance.
Appreciate terms related to field holding capacity for produce.
Consider growth rate when selecting seeds.
Apply uniformity terms for consistent crop results.
Interpret flavor descriptors in seed catalogs.
